sections.title: Section I
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: Meiosis is significant because it:
Chromosomes play a role in cell division by:
Haploid cells are characterized by:
selectableOptions: Having a diploid number of chromosomes

questions.question: Meiosis occurs in:
The main difference between mitosis and meiosis is:
selectableOptions: Mitosis produces two genetically identical daughter cells, while meiosis produces four daughter cells that are genetically different.
The presence of crossing over in mitosis, while no crossing over occurs in meiosis
Mitosis produces haploid cells while meiosis produces diploid cells
Mitosis occurs in plants while meiosis occurs in animals
questions.wordAnswer: The number of daughter cells produced

questions.question: Diploid cells are characterized by:
selectableOptions: Having a haploid number of chromosomes

questions.question: The process of meiosis occurs in:

sections.title: Section II
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of meiosis but not mitosis?
What is the function of the centromere during cell division?
Which of the following occurs during prophase of mitosis?
selectableOptions: Chromosomes align at the cell equator

questions.question: What is the purpose of cytokinesis during cell division?
selectableOptions: Division of the cytoplasm to form two separate daughter cells
questions.wordAnswer: Division of the cytoplasm to form two separate daughter cells

questions.question: What is the purpose of crossing over during meiosis?
Which of the following best defines chromosomes?
Which of the following  best describes haploid cells?
selectableOptions: Cells with half the number of chromosomes compared to diploid cells
Cells with double the number of chromosomes compared to diploid cells
questions.wordAnswer: Cells with half the number of chromosomes compared to diploid cells

questions.question: Which of the following correctly describes the process of mitosis?
selectableOptions: Division of a diploid cell into two identical diploid daughter cells
Division of a haploid cell into four non-identical haploid daughter cells
Division of a diploid cell into four non-identical haploid daughter cells
Division of a haploid cell into two identical diploid daughter cells
questions.wordAnswer: Division of a diploid cell into two identical diploid daughter cells

questions.question: What is the main difference between mitosis and meiosis?
selectableOptions: Mitosis results in the formation of diploid cells, while meiosis results in the formation of haploid cells
Mitosis involves two rounds of cell division, while meiosis involves only one round
Mitosis produces genetically identical daughter cells, while meiosis produces genetically diverse daughter cells
Mitosis in sexual reproduction, while meiosis is important in asexual reproduction
questions.wordAnswer: Mitosis results in the formation of diploid cells, while meiosis results in the formation of haploid cells

questions.question: What is the significance of meiosis in organisms?
selectableOptions: To prevent doubling of the chromosome number in each generation
To increase the size of the organism
questions.wordAnswer: To maintain the chromosome number in each generation

questions.question: Which of the following is the site of meiosis in a male human?
What is the process of mitosis?
selectableOptions: Division of the nucleus into two identical daughter nuclei
Exchange of genetic material between homologous chromosomes
Formation of gametes with half the number of chromosomes
Formation of a zygote through fertilization
questions.wordAnswer: Division of the nucleus into two identical daughter nuclei

questions.question: What is the process of meiosis?
selectableOptions: Exchange of genetic material between homologous chromosomes
Formation of gametes with half the number of chromosomes
Formation of a zygote through fertilization
Division of the nucleus into two identical daughter nuclei
questions.wordAnswer: Formation of gametes with half the number of chromosomes

sections.title: Section III
sections.directions:
Each question consists of three responses. 
One or more of the response(s) is or are correct. 
Select: 
A. If 1, 2 and 3 are all correct. 
B. If 1 and 2 only are correct. 
C. If 2 and 3 only are correct. 
D. If 1 only is correct.

questions.question: Events that occur during interphase include:
nonSelectableOptions: Accumulation of energy in the form of ATP

questions.question: During metaphase of mitosis:
nonSelectableOptions: Chromosomes align at the equatorial plane of the cell.
Chromosomes are pulled towards opposite poles.

questions.question: Mitosis is important in:
Meiosis is important in:
The significance of Meiosis I is:
nonSelectableOptions: To separate the members of a bivalent

sections.title: Section IV
sections.directions:
Each question consists of a First and Second statements. 
Choose: 
A. If both statements are true and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first. 
B. If both statements are true and the second statement is not a correct explanation of the first. 
C. If the first statement is true and the second statement is false. 
D. If the first statement is false and the second statement is true.

selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: Meiosis is important in sexual reproduction
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is True. Second statement is False

twoStatements: Daughter cells produced by mitosis are haploid.
Mitosis maintains a constant chromosome number in body cells.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: First statement is False. Second statement is True

twoStatements: Sister chromatids of a chromosome are identical to each other.
During metaphase of mitosis, chromosomes are aligned at the equator.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is NOT a correct explanation of the first

twoStatements: During anaphase, chromosomes are pulled towards opposite poles.
selectableOptions: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first
Both statements are True and the second statement is NOT a correct explanation of the first
First statement is True. Second statement is False
First statement is False. Second statement is True
questions.wordAnswer: Both statements are True and the second statement is a correct explanation of the first

sections.title: Section V
sections.directions:
Each question consists of four lettered headings A, B, C and D. 
Select the heading which is closely related to the description.

questions.question: Formation of bivalent
Points of crossing over:
Thread-like structures in the nucleus:
It involves the formation of a division furrow along the equator in animal cells.
It involves the break down of the Nucleolus and nuclear membrane.
It involves the reformation of nucleolus and nuclear membrane.
The point at which sister chromatids are attached to each other:
It contains haploid number of chromosomes
It produces spindle fibers used to separate chromosomes.
It prevents doubling of chromosome number in offspring.

sections.title: Section VI
sections.directions: Each question or incomplete statement is followed by four suggested answers. Select the best answer in each case.

questions.question: It results in daughter cells that are genetically identical
It restores the diploid number of chromosomes in a species.
It results in offspring having the ability to adapt to adapt to constantly changing environment.
The stage in mitosis during which chromosomes shorten and thicken, becoming visible:
It represents the 46 chromosomes in a human somatic cell:
It represents the 23 chromosomes in a human gamete.
Which of the following is common to both mitosis and meiosis?
selectableOptions: Both lead to growth in multicellular organisms

questions.question: It involves two nuclear divisions
It consists of nucleic acid (DNA) and histone proteins.
The purpose of Meiosis II is:
selectableOptions: To produce genetically identical daughter cells.
To allow crossing over to occur.
